  <meta name="description" content="Simplified JavaScript Jargon (short SJSJ) is a community-driven attempt at explaining the loads of buzzwords making the current JavaScript ecosystem in a few simple words. The idea is not to replace individual documentations, but to act as some kind of glossary that can be easily referenced.
">

   <div class="box"> 
    <p class="intro">If you enjoy Simplified JavaScript Jargon, be sure to check the related <a href="/related/">projects</a>!</p> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “a”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">A</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/AJAX.md"><abbr title="Asynchronous JavaScript and XML">Ajax</abbr></a>: a technology for asynchronous <abbr title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</abbr> requests</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/AMD.md"><abbr title="Asynchronous Module Definition">AMD</abbr></a>: a standard defining how to load JavaScript libraries or modules asynchronously</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ANGULARJS.md">AngularJS</a>: a structural framework for dynamic web apps</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/APACHECORDOVA.md">Apache Cordova</a>: a popular mobile application development framework originally created by Nitobi</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ARITY.md">Arity</a>: the number of arguments of a function</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “b”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">B</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BABEL.md">Babel</a>: a JavaScript transformation toolkit which started as an ECMAScript 2015 / <abbr title="ECMAScript 6">ES6</abbr> code translator (transpiler)</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BACKBONE.md">Backbone</a>: a structural framework for dynamic web apps</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BEM.md"><abbr title="Block Element Modifier">BEM</abbr></a>: a methodology and libraries developed and used at Yandex for building user interfaces</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BLUEBIRD.md">Bluebird</a>: a fully featured Promise library with focus on innovative features and performance</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BOWER.md">Bower</a>: a package manager for front-end dependencies</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BROCCOLI.md">Broccoli</a>: a fast and reliable asset pipeline</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BROWSERIFY.md">Browserify</a>: a tool making possible to use the `require` function from Node.js within the browser</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/BRUNCH.md">Brunch</a>: a tool focusing on the production of deployment-ready files from development files</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “c”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">C</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CANVAS.md">Canvas</a>: an <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr> element for graphic applications in 2D or 3D</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CHAI.md">Chai</a>: an assertion library used with a JavaScript testing framework</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CHAKRA.md">Chakra</a>: a JavaScript engine developed by Microsoft for its Edge browser which could also be used with Node.js instead of V8.</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CLOSURE.md">Closure</a>: a way of referencing variables from a child function while retaining their value even if it changes in the parent function</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CLOSURE_COMPILER.md">Closure Compiler</a>: a JavaScript checker and optimizer</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/COFFEESCRIPT.md">Coffeescript</a>: a language that compiles into JavaScript</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/COMMONJS.md">CommonJS</a>: a project with the goal of specifying an ecosystem for JavaScript outside the browser (for example, on the server or for native desktop applications)</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CORS.md"><abbr title="Cross Origin Resource sharing">CORS</abbr></a>: a way for a server to make things accessible to pages hosted on other domains</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/COUCHDB.md">CouchDB</a>: a NoSQL database with JavaScript as query language and <abbr title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</abbr> as <abbr title="Application Program Interface">API</abbr></li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/CURRYING.md">Currying</a>: the process to transform a function with multiple parameters into a chain of functions of one parameter</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “d”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">D</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/D3JS.md">D3.js</a>: a library for manipulating documents based on data</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/DESIGN_PATTERNS.md">Design Patterns</a>: a general reusable solution to a commonly occurring problem within a given context in software design</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/DOM.md"><abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr></a>: a platform- and language-neutral interface that allow programs and scripts to dynamically access and update the content, structure and style of documents</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “e”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">E</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ECMASCRIPT.md">ECMAScript (<abbr title="ECMAScript">ES</abbr>)</a>: the standardized specification of the scripting language used by JavaScript</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ELECTRON.md">Electron</a>: a framework based on Node.js lets you write cross-platform desktop applications using <abbr title="JavaScript">JS</abbr>, <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr> and <abbr title="Cascading StyleSheets">CSS</abbr></li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/EMBER.md">Ember</a>: an application framework based on the model-view-controller pattern</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ENZYME.md">Enzyme</a>: a JavaScript Testing utility for React developed by AirBnB that makes it easier to assert, manipulate, and traverse React components’ output.</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ESLINT.md">ESLint</a>: a JavaScript code linter</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/EXPRESS.md">Express</a>: a fast, un-opinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/EXTJS.md">Ext <abbr title="JavaScript">JS</abbr></a>: a pure JavaScript application framework for building interactive cross platform web applications</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “f”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">F</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FACADE_PATTERN.md">Facade Pattern</a>: a software design pattern commonly used with object-oriented programming. The name is by analogy to an architectural facade</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FACTORY_PATTERN.md">Factory Pattern</a>: a creational pattern that uses factory methods to deal with the problem of creating objects without having to specify the exact class of the object that will be created</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FALCOR.md">Falcor</a>: a JavaScript library for efficient data fetching</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FLOW.md">Flow</a>: a static type checker, designed to find type errors in JavaScript programs</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FLUX.md">Flux</a>: an application structure focusing on improved data flow</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/FOUR.md">Four</a>: a framework to develop 3D content for the web</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “g”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">G</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/GRUNT.md">Grunt</a>: a task runner aiming at automating tedious and possibly complex tasks</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/GULP.md">Gulp</a>: a task runner aiming at automating tedious and possibly complex tasks</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “h”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">H</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/HAPI.md">Hapi</a>: a Node <abbr title="JavaScript">JS</abbr> framework for writing services and more</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/HOISTING.md">Hoisting</a>: an action performed by the JavaScript interpreter that moves function and variable declarations to the top of their containing scope</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “i”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">I</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/IIFE.md"><abbr title="Immediately Invoked Function Expression">IIFE</abbr></a>: a function that gets called immediately after declaration</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/IONIC.md">Ionic</a>: a <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML5</abbr> mobile framework to build beautiful hybrid native mobile applications using AngularJS and Cordova</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ISOMORPHIC.md">Isomorphic</a>: an application is said to be isomorphic (universal) when its code can run both in the client and the server</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “j”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">J</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JASMINE.md">Jasmine</a>: a testing framework for <abbr title="Behaviour Driven Development">BDD</abbr> (Behaviour-Driven Development)</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JQUERY.md">jQuery</a>: a fast, small, and feature-rich client-side library</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSCS.md">JSCS</a>: a JavaScript code linter</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSHINT.md">JSHint</a>: a JavaScript code linter</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSLINT.md">JSLint</a>: a JavaScript code linter</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSON-LD.md"><abbr title="JSON for Linked Data">JSON-LD</abbr></a>: <abbr title="JavaScript Object Notation">JSON</abbr> for Linked Data</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSON.md"><abbr title="JavaScript Object Notation">JSON</abbr></a>: a lightweight data-interchange format</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSPM.md">JSPM</a>: like npm with its own build system and multiple resources management</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/JSX.md">JSX</a>: an <abbr title="Extensible Markup Language">XML</abbr>-like syntax extension to JavaScript</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “k”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">K</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/KNOCKOUT.md">Knockout</a>: a library that helps developers creating user interfaces with a clean underlying data model</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “l”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">L</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/LOCALFORAGE.md">LocalForage</a>: a fast and simple storage library for JavaScript</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/LODASH.md">Lodash</a>: an utility toolkit to extend JavaScript primitive types</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “m”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">M</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MEAN.md">MEAN</a>: the technology stack MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS, and Node.js (MEAN)</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MEDIATOR_PATTERN.md">Mediator Pattern</a>: an object that encapsulates how a set of objects interact</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MEMOIZE.md">Memoize</a>: an optimization used to speed up consecutive function calls by caching the result of calls with identical input</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/METALSMITH.md">Metalsmith</a>: a simple, pluggable static site generator</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/METEOR.md">Meteor</a>: a JavaScript web framework that allows rapid prototypic web development</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MOCHA.md">Mocha</a>: an extensible testing framework for <abbr title="Test Driven Development">TDD</abbr> (Test-Driven Development) or <abbr title="Behaviour Driven Development">BDD</abbr> (Behaviour-Driven Development)</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MODERNIZR.md">Modernizr</a>: a browser feature detection library, useful to modify page styles when a feature is not available in the browser</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MODULE_PATTERN.md">Module Pattern</a>: a design pattern used to implement the concept of software modules, defined by modular programming, in a programming language with incomplete direct support for the concept</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MOMENTJS.md">Moment.js</a>: a library to parse, validate, manipulate and display dates</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MONGODB.md">MongoDB</a>: a Javascript NoSQL database</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/MOOTOOLS.md">MooTools</a>: a collection of JavaScript utilities designed for the intermediate to advanced JavaScript developer. It allows you to write powerful and flexible code with its elegant, well documented, and coherent APIs</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “n”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">N</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/NIGHTMARE.md">Nightmare</a>: a high-level browser automation library</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/NIGHTWATCHJS.md">NightwatchJS</a>: a framework for browser automated testing</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/NODEJS.md">Node.js</a>: a cross-platform runtime environment for developing server-side applications built on V8 engine</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/NPM.md">npm</a>: a utility to help publishing packages to, and installing from, an npm repository</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/NVM.md">nvm</a>: a utility to help run multiple versions of Node.js on the same machine</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “o”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">O</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/OBSERVER_PATTERN.md">Observer Pattern</a>: a software design pattern in which an object, called the subject, maintains a list of its dependents, called observers, and notifies them automatically of any state changes, usually by calling one of their methods</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “p”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">P</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PASSPORTJS.md">Passport.js</a>: a simple authentication middleware</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PHANTOMJS.md">PhantomJS</a>: a scripted, headless browser used for automating web page interaction</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/POLYMER.md">Polymer</a>: Google’s library for creating Web Components</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/POSTCSS.md">PostCSS</a>: a tool to transform <abbr title="Cascading StyleSheets">CSS</abbr> styles using JavaScript plugins; plugins include autoprefixer, future <abbr title="Cascading StyleSheets">CSS</abbr> transpiling, <abbr title="Cascading StyleSheets">CSS</abbr> linting and media queries</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PROMISE.md">Promise</a>: a proxy for a value not necessarily known immediately but that will eventually be resolved</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PROTOTYPEJS.md">Prototype</a>: a JavaScript framework that aims to ease development of dynamic web applications. It offers a familiar class-style <abbr title="Object Oriented">OO</abbr> framework, extensive <abbr title="Asynchronous JavaScript and XML">Ajax</abbr> support, higher-order programming constructs, and easy <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> manipulation</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PROTOTYPE_PATTERN.md">Prototype Pattern</a>: a creational design pattern in software development. It is used when the type of objects to create is determined by a prototypical instance, which is cloned to produce new objects</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/PURE_FUNCTION.md">Pure Function</a>: a functional programming paradigm that ensures that a function has some strict properties.</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “q”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">Q</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/Q.md">Q</a>: a library to create and manage promises</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/QUNIT.md">QUnit</a>: a powerful, easy-to-use JavaScript unit testing framework</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “r”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">R</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/RAMDA.md">Ramda</a>: a practical functional library for JavaScript programmers</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/REACT.md">React</a>: a library developed and used at Facebook for building user interfaces</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/REDUX.md">Redux</a>: a predictable state container for apps</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/REQUIREJS.md">RequireJS</a>: a browser based module loader using <abbr title="Asynchronous Module Definition">AMD</abbr></li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/REVEALING_MODULE_PATTERN.md">Revealing Module Pattern</a>: a design pattern conceptually based on the Module Pattern. The only difference is that the *revealing module pattern* was engineered as a way to ensure that all methods and variables are kept private until they are explicitly exposed</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/RNPM.md"><abbr title="React Native Package Manager">rnpm</abbr></a>: a package manager to ease React Native development</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/RXJS.md">RxJS</a>: a library for asynchronous programming using observable streams</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “s”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">S</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/SAILS.md">Sails</a>: a realtime <abbr title="Model View Controller">MVC</abbr> Framework for Node.js</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/SINGLETON_PATTERN.md">Singleton Pattern</a>: a design pattern that restricts the instantiation of a class to one object</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “t”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">T</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/THREEJS.md">Three.js</a>: a lightweight 3D library to create and display animated 3D computer graphics on a Web browser</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/TYPESCRIPT.md">TypeScript</a>: a super-set of the JavaScript language that introduces types</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “u”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">U</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/UMD.md"><abbr title="Universal Module Definition">UMD</abbr></a>: a pattern of universal module definition for JavaScript modules</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/UNDERSCORE.md">Underscore</a>: a swiss army knife, focusing on helper methods for most built-in objects</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/UNIVERSAL.md">Universal</a>: an application is said to be universal (isomorphic) when its code can run both in the client and the server</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “v”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">V</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/V8.md">V8</a>: Google’s open source JavaScript engine. It’s what Chrome is running, but it’s also used for other projects like Node.js and MongoDB</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/VANILLA.md">Vanilla</a>: a term for library/framework free JavaScript</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/VIRTUAL_DOM.md">Virtual <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr></a>: a pattern in which a JavaScript representation of the desired <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> is created and the framework sorts out the details of how to make it happen</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/VUEJS.md">VueJS</a>: a library for creating user interfaces based on data models</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “w”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">W</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/WEBGL.md"><abbr title="Web Graphics Library">WebGL</abbr></a>: a JavaScript <abbr title="Application Program Interface">API</abbr> for rendering interactive 3D and 2D graphics within any compatible web browser without the use of plug-ins</li> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/WEBPACK.md">Webpack</a>: a dependency manager with a friendly and fast development environment, simplifying a lot of common tasks</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “x”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">X</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/XHR.md"><abbr title="XMLHttpRequest">XHR</abbr></a>: XMLHttpRequest is an <abbr title="Application Program Interface">API</abbr> that provides client functionality for transferring data between a client and a server without page refresh</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “y”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">Y</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/YEOMAN.md">Yeoman</a>: a generator builder to speed up the setup and installation process of a project or part of a project</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
    <section aria-label="Entries starting with “z”"> 
     <span class="as-h1">Z</span> 
     <ul class="index-list"> 
      <li><a href="/_glossary/ZEPTO.md">Zepto</a>: a lightweight jQuery clone, without all the browser-compatibility specific code</li> 
     </ul> 
    </section> 
   </div> 
  </main>

The idea is not to replace individual documentations, but to act as some kind of glossary that can be easily referenced.</p>
